lines.text: [on board a badly shot up HMNZS Achilles]
Captain, sir.
Yes, guns?
We've fired nearly 1200 rounds sir. About one third of the arsenal only remaining.
Thank you. Are you all right?
A few new ventilation gaps here, sir. A bit draughty, but otherwise all right.
[Capt. Parry turns to look at gunnery control position full of shell holes]

[to Captain Dove]
Every commander is alone, Captain.

[McCall is telephoning the British Ambassador in Buenos Aires to try to spread a rumour]
An emergency has arisen over the 'Graf Spee'.
lines.character: Captain McCall - R.N., British Naval Attache for Buenos Aires

lines.text: Careful, McCall - security.
I know, sir, but this is most urgent. I have just heard by Admiralty code...
lines.character: Captain McCall - R.N., British Naval Attache for Buenos Aires

lines.text: This isn't a scrambler, you know.
...that two of our capital ships...
lines.character: Captain McCall - R.N., British Naval Attache for Buenos Aires

lines.text: Are you MAD, McCall? I'm going to hang up!
Sir, I must insist - in this case urgency overrides security.
lines.character: Captain McCall - R.N., British Naval Attache for Buenos Aires

lines.text: 'Urgency overrides security?' Well, well, well, go on, go on.
Both these capital ships will be calling in the next few hours at Bahia...
lines.character: Captain McCall - R.N., British Naval Attache for Buenos Aires

lines.text: I told you before, this is not a scrambler!
...at Bahia Blanca to refuel.
lines.character: Captain McCall - R.N., British Naval Attache for Buenos Aires

lines.text: MCCALL!

[Groans]
Oh...
lines.character: Mr. Millington Drake - British Minister, Montevideo

lines.text: They'll be down to their last drop when they arrive.
lines.character: Captain McCall - R.N., British Naval Attache for Buenos Aires

lines.text: Stop it, stop it!
They... they've steamed at full speed for the Plate for obvious reasons...
lines.character: Captain McCall - R.N., British Naval Attache for Buenos Aires

lines.text: Fellow's raving mad.
They request that we arrange for 2,000 tons of fuel oil...
lines.character: Captain McCall - R.N., British Naval Attache for Buenos Aires

lines.text: Really McCall, YOU MUST STOP!
...of fuel oil to be available in tankers as from tonight.
lines.character: Captain McCall - R.N., British Naval Attache for Buenos Aires

lines.text:
[Silence, as Ambassador realises what McCall is doing]
Oh... very well, McCall. Yes, we got your message.
[Hangs up]

The afternoon papers'll be out soon. Knowing how leaky the telephone cables are between here and Buenos Aires, I shall expect to see the headlines screaming that half the British fleet are off Punta del Este.
Can reach Plymouth if ordered...
